channel.title: Recent Posts | MacMenuBar.com
channel.description: Recent Posts | MacMenuBar.com - Powered by RSSHub

item.title: DiskView
item.description:
DiskView shows all mounted drives with free and used space at a glance. Simple, minimal, and efficient for quick disk monitoring.

Visit

item.title: MaClicker
item.description:
MaClicker is a simple auto-clicker for Mac. It is built with Swift and requires macOS 10.13 High Sierra or later. It can achieve up to 100 clicks per second.

Visit

item.title: MenuBar IP
item.description:
MenuBar IP displays your Mac’s public IP address in the menu bar, making it easy to monitor your network, verify VPN locations, and access geolocation insights instantly.

Visit

item.title: Command Keeper
item.description:
This menu bar app lets you organize your command-line snippets, Bash scripts, and even SQL queries, giving you quick access to them anytime from virtually any program. Works on macOS Ventura, Sonoma, and Sequoia.

Visit Watch

item.title: FlexiBackup
item.description:
This menu bar app makes it easy to change your iOS backup location, allowing you to store backups on an external hard drive instead of taking up space on your Mac or iCloud.

Visit Watch

item.title: Deplog
item.description:
Monitor your Vercel deployments directly from your Mac’s menu bar — all without opening a browser.

Visit

item.title: Overkill
item.description:
This menu bar app makes sure iTunes never interrupts your work. If you have other apps you don’t want to launch automatically (e.g. Photos app), you can add those apps to the Overkill list as well.

Visit Watch

item.title: Ping Menubar
item.description:
This menu bar app displays ongoing ping (ICMP) results as a compact visualization. The design is similar to Pingr.

Visit

item.title: Semantic SF
item.description:
This menu bar app lets you use natural language to search through SF Symbols.

Visit

item.title: Netlify Deploy Status
item.description:
This menu bar app is designed to keep you informed about the current deploy status of your Netlify sites. Whether you’re deploying a new version of your site or monitoring ongoing builds, this app gives you easy access to deployment updates in real-time.

Visit Watch

item.title: Automation Clipper
item.description:
A menu bar app for easily launching Python programs with a boost of inspiration.

Visit

item.title: FreeSpace
item.description:
This menu bar app shows all mounted volumes along with the available free space on each. If you only want to monitor a particular volume, you can choose to have that volume’s free space displayed right in the menu bar.

Visit

item.title: CPU Menu bar app
item.description:
A simple menu bar app, just showing the CPU percentage.

Visit

item.title: Easy Ethernet Icon
item.description:
This menu bar app shows your Ethernet connection status at a glance.

Visit

item.title: Transloader
item.description:
This menu bar app lets you initiate downloads on your Mac – remotely from your iPhone, iPad, or other Macs.

Visit Watch

item.title: Microsoft NTFS for Mac
item.description:
This menu bar app lets you write, edit, copy, move and delete files on Microsoft NTFS volumes from your Mac. Mount, unmount, verify, format or set any of your Microsoft NTFS volumes as a startup drive.

Visit

item.title: Mounty for NTFS
item.description:
You can use this menu bar app to re-mount write-protected NTFS volumes under macOS in read-write mode.

Visit

item.title: Online Check
item.description:
Check if you are online directly from the menu bar. The menu bar icon turns red when you are offline.

Visit

item.title: StyleGuide
item.description:
This menu bar app makes it easy for iOS & other Apple platform developers to quickly preview HIG typography, colors and sizes.

Visit

item.title: Hammer
item.description:
Hammer is a menu bar Icon app that assist its users in converting their clipboard data from one form to another quickly.

Visit Watch

item.title: Brew Services
item.description:
This menu bar app lets you (re)start and stop homebrew services.

Visit

item.title: Icon Preview
item.description:
Preview how your app icon will look in the menu bar. You can also drag and drop an image onto the menu bar icon to preview it there. Ideal for developers and designers to perfect the look of their app icons.

Visit

item.title: Zshistory
item.description:
This menu bar app lets you to search through your recent terminal commands. It currently supports only zsh, which is the default shell in macOS.

Visit

item.title: DevControls
item.description:
Add your favorite repositories, folders and urls into your menu bar.

Visit

item.title: IsThereNet
item.description:
See when your internet disconnects and reconnects. A green top status line means connected; Red means disconnected (and Yellow means slow internet). The status line does not display in screenshots and does not interfere with menu bar navigation.

Visit

item.title: Trash Buddy
item.description:
This menu bar app puts a large, freely movable Trash icon on your Desktop, and can automatically empty the Trash every 30 minutes to 24 hours.

Visit

item.title: Find my ports
item.description:
This menu bar app lets you manage all open development ports and remote Vercel deployment.

Visit

item.title: Peek
item.description:
This menu bar app is designed for developers to monitor their OpenAI API usage and costs. No more constantly opening and closing browsers just to keep an eye on your API consumption.

Visit

item.title: Pingu
item.description:
This menu bar app, well… it pings.

Visit

item.title: GitStatus
item.description:
This menu bar app shows all your GitHub notifications (macOS 13.0+). So you don’t have to open GitHub every 5 minutes. 😉

Visit

item.title: MiniSim
item.description:
MiniSim is a menu bar app for launching iOS and Android emulators: All your emulators right in your menu bar without opening Android Studio or Xcode.

Visit

item.title: Timkee
item.description:
Timkee allows you to create, edit and delete JIRA time logs (automatically and manually). It gives you an overview of the latest time logs you have created and can be accessed right of your Mac′s menu bar, without opening JIRA.

Visit Watch

item.title: RerouteMe
item.description:
Just one click in your menu bar app to switch between Proxy Configurations. You can switch between a Localhost, WAN, or Custom Proxy Configuration.

Visit

item.title: XcLauncher
item.description:
XcLauncher is a menu bar app that provides instant access to your favorite projects, workspaces, playgrounds and Swift files. It’s like having browser bookmarks for your Xcode files.

Visit

item.title: Pulse for Plausible Analytics
item.description:
This menu bar app shows the latest stats from Plausible Analytics, a privacy-friendly Google Analytics alternative.

Visit

item.title: FilevaultReboot
item.description:
This menu bar app (open source) allows you to initial a FileVault Restart.

Visit

item.title: NZB Control
item.description:
With this menu bar app you can monitor and control your SABnzbd (binary newsreader) or NZBGet (usenet downloader) application.

Visit

  •

item.title: OpenPorts
item.description:
List, browse, copy, terminate or kill open ports. All from your Mac’s menu bar.

Visit

item.title: ContriBar
item.description:
ContriBar displays your Github contribution calendar right in your Mac’s menu bar.

Visit

item.title: SnapAPI
item.description:
SnapAPI is the quickest way (just a click) to access APIs from your Mac’s menu bar. No more hassle of using complicated tools to run APIs.

Visit

item.title: DriveDx
item.description:
DriveDx is a menu bar app that monitors the drive’s built-in S.M.A.R.T. status. It also analyzes the changes of all drive health indicators that are closely related to SSD or HDD failures and alerts you if the quality of a drive degrades.

Visit Watch

item.title: Buildwatch
item.description:
Buildwatch is a menu bar app for developers using Xcode that tracks, graphs, and analyzes how much of their time is spent compiling so they can build apps more efficiently.

Visit

item.title: Shuttle
item.description:
When you want to access another computer remotely, you’ll need the SSH protocol. Shuttle brings the SSH client to your menu bar.

Visit

item.title: AppPolice
item.description:
This menu bar app lets you quickly throttle down the CPU usage of any running process or application.

Visit

item.title: Public IP
item.description:
This menu bar app displays you public IP Address and is updated frequently. The frequency can be adjusted to meet your needs.

Visit

item.title: Arch Info
item.description:
This menu bar app tells you if the currently selected application is an Apple Silicon or an Intel (translated via Rosetta 2) application.

Visit

item.title: Airplane for Mac
item.description:
Just like on your iPhone, turn off the wireless features on your Mac anytime & anywhere.

Visit Watch

item.title: SF Menu Bar
item.description:
SF Menu Bar lets you browse and search SF Symbols, iconography designed to integrate seamlessly with San Francisco, the system font for Apple platforms.

Visit Watch

item.title: HIG Typography
item.description:
This menu bar app enables iOS and macOS developers to reference Apple’s text styles from their menu bar.

Visit Watch

item.title: DataCever
item.description:
This menu bar app allows you to monitor and control internet traffic, allowing you to know what consumes your data plan. You can also specify quota for each application.

Visit Watch

item.title: Menu Bar Scripts
item.description:
Run any AppleScript with one click from your menu bar.

Visit

item.title: PullBar
item.description:
Access all your GitHub pull requests just in one click. You can also follow the review progress of pull requests created by you and check the build status of GitHub checks.

There’s also a pro version available.

Visit

item.title: Macs Fan Control
item.description:
By default, Apple runs your Mac’s fans automatically. This menu bar app lets you manually control your fan speed and temperatures.

Visit Watch

item.title: Neat
item.description:
All your GitHub notifications in your menu bar, so you can streamline your code review and ship with ease.

Visit

item.title: Speedy
item.description:
Speedy lets you perform a full speedtest in under ten seconds, directly from your menu bar through Apple’s servers.

Visit

item.title: Pingr
item.description:
This simple app shows your internet speed in the menu bar.

Visit

item.title: Symbar
item.description:
Quickly access SF Symbols straight from your menu bar (list or grid view). Search or click on a symbol to copy its name to your clipboard. Toggle multicolor or monochrome rendering.

Visit

item.title: ADB tools
item.description:
A menu bar app for common adb (Android Debug Bridge) tools like Connect device over tcp,Take screenshots and record screen, Open deeplinks, and Capture logcat.

Visit

item.title: Jandi
item.description:
This menu bar app lets you easily check your github contributions count.

Visit

item.title: Übersicht
item.description:
Übersicht is a menu bar app that lets you run system commands and display their output on your desktop in little containers, called widgets. Keep an eye on what’s happening on your machine and in the world.

Visit Watch

item.title: Ejectify
item.description:
Ejectify automatically unmounts external volumes when your Mac starts sleeping, and mounts them again after it wakes up.

Useful when you have connected a USB drive to a display that powers off when your Mac starts sleeping, causing the drive to be ejected.

Visit

item.title: Gitify
item.description:
All your GitHub notifications, displayed in your menu bar. Gitify informs you for any GitHub notifications without being annoying. Works with GitHub and GitHub Enterprise. You can even connect multiple accounts.

Visit

item.title: Silicon Info
item.description:
Silicon Info is a tiny menu bar app that allows you to quickly view the architecture of the currently running application.

Visit

item.title: Xclean
item.description:
Xclean is menu bar app that provides a convenient way to clear Xcode’s derived data or module cache. It also supports automatic removal of derived data that is no longer associated with an existing project.

Visit

item.title: Menu Bar Docker
item.description:
This menu bar app shows the Docker containers running on your machine so you can start/stop them with a simple click.

Visit

item.title: Remote Wake Up
item.description:
Remote Wake Up allows you to remotely switch on, reboot or shut down every device over your LAN. You can even wake up devices over the internet.

Visit

item.title: Switch Manager
item.description:
With this menu bar app you can manage all your frequently used Switches from one place.

Visit

item.title: Git Streaks
item.description:
Git Streaks is a menu bar app that shows your GitHub green squares and contribution stats.

Visit

item.title: yFi
item.description:
yFi is a menu bar app that continuously monitors your WiFi TX Rate and reconnects if it’s getting bad. This ensures you’ll never have lags and dropouts in online meetings.

Visit Watch

item.title: GitPigeon
item.description:
GitPigeon displays notifications from GitHub in your menu bar. See all your GitHub issues and pull requests in one app.

Visit Watch

item.title: FastScripts
item.description:
With FastScripts you can quickly execute AppleScript and shell scripts from within your menu bar. Free to use with up to 10 shortcuts.

Visit

item.title: Litur
item.description:
Litur is a color picker built for designers and developers. This menu bar app helps you find, collect and organize all the colors around you.

Visit Watch

item.title: CCMenu
item.description:
With CCMenu you can keep track of your repositories’ latest build status. It also sends notifications when a build status changes.

Visit

item.title: PiBar
item.description:
PiBar gives you all the tools you need to manage your Pi-hole right from your menu bar. It even supports multiple Pi-holes.

Visit

item.title: Memory Diag
item.description:
Memory Diag helps you to keep an eye on your systems memory. Quickly access detailed memory information and diagnosis with one click on your menu bar.

Visit

item.title: Appstat
item.description:
Are you an app developer with an active subscription with Apple? This menu bar app displays all the apps you have for sale and how much you are making with each one.

Visit

item.title: StatusBuddy
item.description:
With StatusBuddy you can quickly check the status of Apple’s various online services, like iCloud, Apple Music, Apple TV+, and App Store Connect.

Visit

item.title: Ethernet Status
item.description:
See the status of your LAN/Ethernet connection right from the menu bar. You can also check the status, IP address and speed of the ethernet adaptors.

Visit

item.title: Gitbar
item.description:
This menu bar app shows your open source GitHub contribution stats and helps you setting your contribution goals.

Visit

item.title: Port Manager
item.description:
Use your menu bar to find, open and kill ports in a couple of clicks. View all of your ports in one place, so you can go back to writing code.

Visit

item.title: ARD Monitor
item.description:
ARD Monitor shows the state of your Apple Remote Desktop (disabled, enabled, connected) – even if the Administrator asked for permission to monitor/control. You can also disconnect connected administrators. It displays your IP- and MAC-addresses, computer name and serial number.

Visit

item.title: SimplePing
item.description:
Check your internet connection quality directly in the menu bar. The ping updates in realtime.

Visit

item.title: iBoysoft NTFS for Mac
item.description:
This menu bar app helps you to read and write to NTFS formatted drives on Macs and transfer files between Macs and PCs.

Visit

item.title: Speedtest for Mac
item.description:
Launching a Speedtest straight from your Mac menu bar is the quickest way to check your connectivity.

Visit

item.title: PingBar
item.description:
PingBar keeps an eye on your server. It will ping your server periodically, and show you the delay in the menubar.

Visit

item.title: Bidbar
item.description:
With Bidbar, all your Terminal commands are at your finger tips, just a click of a button or a tap of a key away.

Visit Watch

item.title: One Switch
item.description:
This menu bar app keeps all your powerful switches in one place: Hide Desktop Icons, Dark Mode, Keep Awake, Screen Saver, AirPods Connect, DND and Night Shift.

Visit

item.title: HDDfancontrol
item.description:
HDD Fan Control controls the fan speed in relation to your drive’s temperature. It even slows the fan down preventing the loud noise and keeping your drive safe from overheating.

Visit

item.title: Almighty
item.description:
Almighty exposes powerful configurations for your Mac, like stopping alerts for installing new major release of macOS, stopping iTunes from automatically opening and much more.

Visit Watch

item.title: Jettison
item.description:
Jettison automatically ejects external disks from your Mac before your computer goes to sleep.

Visit

item.title: Analytics Bar
item.description:
Realtime Google Analytics in your menu bar! This application delivers real time / current Google Analytics stats for the day of all your tracked websites.

Visit

item.title: Web Ping
item.description:
This menu bar app will ping all your websites straight from your computer and notify you when something is wrong with any of them, or when a broken website is back online.

Visit

item.title: TripMode
item.description:
With TripMode you can prevent apps from connecting to the internet when you are using a mobile hotspot. This prevents unexpected bills for high data usage on your mobile plan.

Visit Watch

item.title: Smart Reporter
item.description:
Smart Reporter sits quietly on your Mac’s menu bar indicating the status of your hard drive, ready to warn you of some hard disk drive failures before they actually happen.

Visit

item.title: Mountain
item.description:
Mountain allows you to mount, eject and remount external volumes without the need of unplugging cables. It automatically ejects all external volumes when the system is going to sleep and mounts your favorite network drives when recovering from sleep.

Visit

item.title: Casilla
item.description:
Casilla is a simple tool that hides and unhides all running applications. Comes in handy when you’re sharing your laptop with a friend or associate.

Visit

item.title: App Tamer
item.description:
App Tamer automatically slows down or pauses your applications whenever you’re not using them, greatly reducing their CPU use.

Visit

item.title: IP in menubar
item.description:
This small application runs in the background and shows your current IP address in the menu bar. If you are behind a router or gateway you can still see your local IP address in the menu.

Visit
